alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Dubois; Orange (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 6:26PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT DUBOIS...NORTHWESTERN CRAWFORD AND SOUTHWESTERN ORANGE COUNTIES THROUGH 700 PM EDT... At 626 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms 7 miles north of Jasper, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Jasper, Huntingburg, Ferdinand, Birdseye, Dubois, Hillham, Celestine, Bretzville, Taswell and Mentor. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Louisville.
